properties.name: camel.cloud.consul.service-discovery.acl-token
properties.description: Sets the ACL token to be used with Consul

properties.name: camel.cloud.consul.service-discovery.block-seconds
properties.description: The seconds to wait for a watch event, default 10 seconds

properties.name: camel.cloud.consul.service-discovery.configurations
properties.description: Define additional configuration definitions

properties.name: camel.cloud.consul.service-discovery.connect-timeout-millis
properties.description: Connect timeout for OkHttpClient

properties.name: camel.cloud.consul.service-discovery.datacenter
properties.description: The data center

properties.name: camel.cloud.consul.service-discovery.enabled
properties.description: Enable the component

properties.name: camel.cloud.consul.service-discovery.password
properties.description: Sets the password to be used for basic authentication

properties.name: camel.cloud.consul.service-discovery.properties
properties.description: Set client properties to use. These properties are specific to what service call implementation are in use. For example if using a different one, then the client properties are defined according to the specific service in use.

properties.name: camel.cloud.consul.service-discovery.read-timeout-millis
properties.description: Read timeout for OkHttpClient

properties.name: camel.cloud.consul.service-discovery.url
properties.description: The Consul agent URL

properties.name: camel.cloud.consul.service-discovery.user-name
properties.description: Sets the username to be used for basic authentication

properties.name: camel.cloud.consul.service-discovery.write-timeout-millis
properties.description: Write timeout for OkHttpClient

properties.name: camel.cloud.dns.service-discovery.configurations
properties.description: Define additional configuration definitions

properties.name: camel.cloud.dns.service-discovery.domain
properties.description: The domain name;

properties.name: camel.cloud.dns.service-discovery.enabled
properties.description: Enable the component

properties.name: camel.cloud.dns.service-discovery.properties
properties.description: Set client properties to use. These properties are specific to what service call implementation are in use. For example if using a different one, then the client properties are defined according to the specific service in use.

properties.name: camel.cloud.dns.service-discovery.proto
properties.description: The transport protocol of the desired service.

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.api-version
properties.description: Sets the API version when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.ca-cert-data
properties.description: Sets the Certificate Authority data when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.ca-cert-file
properties.description: Sets the Certificate Authority data that are loaded from the file when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.client-cert-data
properties.description: Sets the Client Certificate data when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.client-cert-file
properties.description: Sets the Client Certificate data that are loaded from the file when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.client-key-algo
properties.description: Sets the Client Keystore algorithm, such as RSA when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.client-key-data
properties.description: Sets the Client Keystore data when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.client-key-file
properties.description: Sets the Client Keystore data that are loaded from the file when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.client-key-passphrase
properties.description: Sets the Client Keystore passphrase when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.configurations
properties.description: Define additional configuration definitions

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.dns-domain
properties.description: Sets the DNS domain to use for DNS lookup.

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.enabled
properties.description: Enable the component

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.lookup
properties.description: How to perform service lookup. Possible values: client, dns, environment. When using client, then the client queries the kubernetes master to obtain a list of active pods that provides the service, and then random (or round robin) select a pod. When using dns the service name is resolved as name.namespace.svc.dnsDomain. When using dnssrv the service name is resolved with SRV query for _._...svc... When using environment then environment variables are used to lookup the service. By default environment is used.

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.master-url
properties.description: Sets the URL to the master when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.namespace
properties.description: Sets the namespace to use. Will by default use namespace from the ENV variable KUBERNETES_MASTER.

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.oauth-token
properties.description: Sets the OAUTH token for authentication (instead of username/password) when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.password
properties.description: Sets the password for authentication when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.port-name
properties.description: Sets the Port Name to use for DNS/DNSSRV lookup.

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.port-protocol
properties.description: Sets the Port Protocol to use for DNS/DNSSRV lookup.

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.properties
properties.description: Set client properties to use. These properties are specific to what service call implementation are in use. For example if using a different one, then the client properties are defined according to the specific service in use.

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.trust-certs
properties.description: Sets whether to turn on trust certificate check when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.cloud.kubernetes.service-discovery.username
properties.description: Sets the username for authentication when using client lookup

properties.name: camel.language.constant.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the constant language. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.language.constant.trim
properties.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

properties.name: camel.language.csimple.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the csimple language. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.language.csimple.trim
properties.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

properties.name: camel.language.exchange-property.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the exchangeProperty language. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.language.exchange-property.trim
properties.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

properties.name: camel.language.file.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the file language. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.language.file.trim
properties.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

properties.name: camel.language.header.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the header language. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.language.header.trim
properties.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

properties.name: camel.language.ref.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the ref language. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.language.ref.trim
properties.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

properties.name: camel.language.simple.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the simple language. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.language.simple.trim
properties.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

properties.name: camel.language.tokenize.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the tokenize language. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.language.tokenize.group-delimiter
properties.description: Sets the delimiter to use when grouping. If this has not been set then token will be used as the delimiter.

properties.name: camel.language.tokenize.trim
properties.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.automatic-transition-from-open-to-half-open-enabled
properties.description: Enables automatic transition from OPEN to HALF_OPEN state once the waitDurationInOpenState has passed.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.circuit-breaker
properties.description: Refers to an existing io.github.resilience4j.circuitbreaker.CircuitBreaker instance to lookup and use from the registry. When using this, then any other circuit breaker options are not in use.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.config
properties.description: Refers to an existing io.github.resilience4j.circuitbreaker.CircuitBreakerConfig instance to lookup and use from the registry.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.configurations
properties.description: Define additional configuration definitions

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.enabled
properties.description: Enable the component

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.failure-rate-threshold
properties.description: Configures the failure rate threshold in percentage. If the failure rate is equal or greater than the threshold the CircuitBreaker transitions to open and starts short-circuiting calls. The threshold must be greater than 0 and not greater than 100. Default value is 50 percentage.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.minimum-number-of-calls
properties.description: Configures the minimum number of calls which are required (per sliding window period) before the CircuitBreaker can calculate the error rate. For example, if minimumNumberOfCalls is 10, then at least 10 calls must be recorded, before the failure rate can be calculated. If only 9 calls have been recorded the CircuitBreaker will not transition to open even if all 9 calls have failed. Default minimumNumberOfCalls is 100

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.permitted-number-of-calls-in-half-open-state
properties.description: Configures the number of permitted calls when the CircuitBreaker is half open. The size must be greater than 0. Default size is 10.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.sliding-window-size
properties.description: Configures the size of the sliding window which is used to record the outcome of calls when the CircuitBreaker is closed. slidingWindowSize configures the size of the sliding window. Sliding window can either be count-based or time-based. If slidingWindowType is COUNT_BASED, the last slidingWindowSize calls are recorded and aggregated. If slidingWindowType is TIME_BASED, the calls of the last slidingWindowSize seconds are recorded and aggregated. The slidingWindowSize must be greater than 0. The minimumNumberOfCalls must be greater than 0. If the slidingWindowType is COUNT_BASED, the minimumNumberOfCalls cannot be greater than slidingWindowSize . If the slidingWindowType is TIME_BASED, you can pick whatever you want. Default slidingWindowSize is 100.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.sliding-window-type
properties.description: Configures the type of the sliding window which is used to record the outcome of calls when the CircuitBreaker is closed. Sliding window can either be count-based or time-based. If slidingWindowType is COUNT_BASED, the last slidingWindowSize calls are recorded and aggregated. If slidingWindowType is TIME_BASED, the calls of the last slidingWindowSize seconds are recorded and aggregated. Default slidingWindowType is COUNT_BASED.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.slow-call-duration-threshold
properties.description: Configures the duration threshold (seconds) above which calls are considered as slow and increase the slow calls percentage. Default value is 60 seconds.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.slow-call-rate-threshold
properties.description: Configures a threshold in percentage. The CircuitBreaker considers a call as slow when the call duration is greater than slowCallDurationThreshold Duration. When the percentage of slow calls is equal or greater the threshold, the CircuitBreaker transitions to open and starts short-circuiting calls. The threshold must be greater than 0 and not greater than 100. Default value is 100 percentage which means that all recorded calls must be slower than slowCallDurationThreshold.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.throw-exception-when-half-open-or-open-state
properties.description: Whether to throw io.github.resilience4j.circuitbreaker.CallNotPermittedException when the call is rejected due circuit breaker is half open or open.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.wait-duration-in-open-state
properties.description: Configures the wait duration (in seconds) which specifies how long the CircuitBreaker should stay open, before it switches to half open. Default value is 60 seconds.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.writable-stack-trace-enabled
properties.description: Enables writable stack traces. When set to false, Exception.getStackTrace returns a zero length array. This may be used to reduce log spam when the circuit breaker is open as the cause of the exceptions is already known (the circuit breaker is short-circuiting calls).

properties.name: camel.rest.api-component
properties.description: The name of the Camel component to use as the REST API. If no API Component has been explicit configured, then Camel will lookup if there is a Camel component responsible for servicing and generating the REST API documentation, or if a org.apache.camel.spi.RestApiProcessorFactory is registered in the registry. If either one is found, then that is being used.

properties.name: camel.rest.api-context-path
properties.description: Sets a leading API context-path the REST API services will be using. This can be used when using components such as camel-servlet where the deployed web application is deployed using a context-path.

properties.name: camel.rest.api-host
properties.description: To use a specific hostname for the API documentation (such as swagger or openapi) This can be used to override the generated host with this configured hostname

properties.name: camel.rest.api-property
properties.description: Allows to configure as many additional properties for the api documentation. For example set property api.title to my cool stuff

properties.name: camel.rest.api-vendor-extension
properties.description: Whether vendor extension is enabled in the Rest APIs. If enabled then Camel will include additional information as vendor extension (eg keys starting with x-) such as route ids, class names etc. Not all 3rd party API gateways and tools supports vendor-extensions when importing your API docs.

properties.name: camel.rest.binding-mode
properties.description: Sets the binding mode to use. The default value is off

properties.name: camel.rest.client-request-validation
properties.description: Whether to enable validation of the client request to check: 1) Content-Type header matches what the Rest DSL consumes; returns HTTP Status 415 if validation error. 2) Accept header matches what the Rest DSL produces; returns HTTP Status 406 if validation error. 3) Missing required data (query parameters, HTTP headers, body); returns HTTP Status 400 if validation error. 4) Parsing error of the message body (JSon, XML or Auto binding mode must be enabled); returns HTTP Status 400 if validation error.

properties.name: camel.rest.component
properties.description: The Camel Rest component to use for the REST transport (consumer), such as netty-http, jetty, servlet, undertow. If no component has been explicit configured, then Camel will lookup if there is a Camel component that integrates with the Rest DSL, or if a org.apache.camel.spi.RestConsumerFactory is registered in the registry. If either one is found, then that is being used.

properties.name: camel.rest.component-property
properties.description: Allows to configure as many additional properties for the rest component in use.

properties.name: camel.rest.consumer-property
properties.description: Allows to configure as many additional properties for the rest consumer in use.

properties.name: camel.rest.context-path
properties.description: Sets a leading context-path the REST services will be using. This can be used when using components such as camel-servlet where the deployed web application is deployed using a context-path. Or for components such as camel-jetty or camel-netty-http that includes a HTTP server.

properties.name: camel.rest.cors-headers
properties.description: Allows to configure custom CORS headers.

properties.name: camel.rest.data-format-property
properties.description: Allows to configure as many additional properties for the data formats in use. For example set property prettyPrint to true to have json outputted in pretty mode. The properties can be prefixed to denote the option is only for either JSON or XML and for either the IN or the OUT. The prefixes are: json.in. json.out. xml.in. xml.out. For example a key with value xml.out.mustBeJAXBElement is only for the XML data format for the outgoing. A key without a prefix is a common key for all situations.

properties.name: camel.rest.enable-cors
properties.description: Whether to enable CORS headers in the HTTP response. The default value is false.

properties.name: camel.rest.endpoint-property
properties.description: Allows to configure as many additional properties for the rest endpoint in use.

properties.name: camel.rest.host
properties.description: The hostname to use for exposing the REST service.

properties.name: camel.rest.host-name-resolver
properties.description: If no hostname has been explicit configured, then this resolver is used to compute the hostname the REST service will be using.

properties.name: camel.rest.inline-routes
properties.description: Inline routes in rest-dsl which are linked using direct endpoints. By default, each service in Rest DSL is an individual route, meaning that you would have at least two routes per service (rest-dsl, and the route linked from rest-dsl). Enabling this allows Camel to optimize and inline this as a single route, however this requires to use direct endpoints, which must be unique per service. This option is default false.

properties.name: camel.rest.json-data-format
properties.description: Name of specific json data format to use. By default jackson will be used. Important: This option is only for setting a custom name of the data format, not to refer to an existing data format instance.

properties.name: camel.rest.port
properties.description: The port number to use for exposing the REST service. Notice if you use servlet component then the port number configured here does not apply, as the port number in use is the actual port number the servlet component is using. eg if using Apache Tomcat its the tomcat http port, if using Apache Karaf its the HTTP service in Karaf that uses port 8181 by default etc. Though in those situations setting the port number here, allows tooling and JMX to know the port number, so its recommended to set the port number to the number that the servlet engine uses.

properties.name: camel.rest.producer-api-doc
properties.description: Sets the location of the api document the REST producer will use to validate the REST uri and query parameters are valid accordingly to the api document. The location of the api document is loaded from classpath by default, but you can use file: or http: to refer to resources to load from file or http url.

properties.name: camel.rest.producer-component
properties.description: Sets the name of the Camel component to use as the REST producer

properties.name: camel.rest.scheme
properties.description: The scheme to use for exposing the REST service. Usually http or https is supported. The default value is http

properties.name: camel.rest.skip-binding-on-error-code
properties.description: Whether to skip binding on output if there is a custom HTTP error code header. This allows to build custom error messages that do not bind to json / xml etc, as success messages otherwise will do.

properties.name: camel.rest.use-x-forward-headers
properties.description: Whether to use X-Forward headers for Host and related setting. The default value is true.

properties.name: camel.rest.xml-data-format
properties.description: Name of specific XML data format to use. By default jaxb will be used. Important: This option is only for setting a custom name of the data format, not to refer to an existing data format instance.
